title: Abu Bakr: The First Caliph
description: One-minute skill: Abu Bakr: The First Caliph.

hook.text: Muhammad died without naming a successor. The crisis that followed still divides Islam 1,400 years later.

buildup.text: Abu Bakr, Muhammad's closest friend, was chosen as the first caliph â€” successor and leader of the Muslim community.

discovery.text: Tribes across Arabia rebelled after Muhammad's death. Abu Bakr fought the Ridda Wars to reunify the Muslim world.

twist.text: Abu Bakr ruled just two years but held Islam together at its most fragile moment. Without him, it might have collapsed.

climax.text: The caliphate model Abu Bakr established shaped Islamic governance for centuries. His brief reign was foundational.

punchline.text: Two years in power, centuries of impact. Abu Bakr saved Islam from collapse.

quiz.question: Why was Abu Bakr's caliphate important?
options: He held Islam together after Muhammad's death
